results.title: Protests following the shooting of Keith Lamont Scott in Charlotte
results.brief_description: BlackLivesMatter started appearing online after a white man was acquitted of killing unarmed black teenager Trayvon Martin in 2012. It has since evolved beyond a hashtag to become a worldwide movement used to unite activists and hold authorities to account.

results.title: Los Angeles riots
results.brief_description: The beating of Rodney King by the LAPD was caught on amateur videotape by George Holliday. Broadcast widely by news outlets, it’s arguably the first video of police brutality to go viral before the internet and was a catalyst for the Los Angeles riots in 1992.
results.description: The brutal beating of Rodney King by the LAPD was caught on amateur videotape by George Holliday. Broadcast widely by news outlets, it is arguably the first video of police brutality to go viral before the internet and the policemen’s acquittal was a catalyst for the Los Angeles riots in 1992. Five days into the rioting and social unrest, King himself appeared on TV, pleading with the public, “Can we all get along?”
description_for_label: The brutal beating of Rodney King by the LAPD was caught on amateur videotape by George Holliday. Broadcast widely by news outlets, it is arguably the first video of police brutality to go viral before the internet and the policemen’s acquittal was a catalyst for the Los Angeles riots in 1992. Five days into the rioting and social unrest, King himself appeared on TV, pleading with the public, “Can we all get along?”

results.title: The Syrian Civil Defence
results.brief_description: Hospitals under siege, constant firefights, the Syrian Civil Defence sifting through bombed buildings. Millions of videos of the Syrian Civil War have been recorded and uploaded to YouTube and online platforms, but has all this footage made any difference?
results.description: Hospitals under siege, constant firefights, the Syrian Civil Defence sifting through bombed buildings. Millions of videos of the Syrian Civil War have been recorded and uploaded to YouTube and online platforms, but has all this footage made any difference?

results.title: Tame the wind
results.creator_credit: Selig Alkon, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Shows how we are now moving to learn to modify the weather to our own ends. The film offers some examples of how weather modification is practised today, and also takes viewers to the Nile Basin where a meteorological survey evokes a far-off dream of making some of the world’s driest desert terrain fertile and fruitful.

results.title: Tahrir Square during the Arab Spring uprising
results.brief_description: In 2011, the connectivity and speed of social media seemed promising for society and democracy. Platforms like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube were integral to mobilising people and coordinating protest movements like the Arab Spring, a series of anti-government protests, uprisings and revolutions.
results.title_for_label: Tahrir Square during the Arab Spring uprising

constellations_other.name: Rodney King LA Riots
constellations_other.description: The brutal beating of Rodney King by the LAPD was caught on amateur videotape and became what is arguably the first video of police brutality to go viral before the internet. It was a catalyst for the 1992 LA riots, which has influenced media ever since.

results.description: The brutal beating of Rodney King by the LAPD was caught on amateur videotape by George Holliday. Broadcast widely by news outlets, it is arguably the first video of police brutality to go viral before the internet and the policemen’s acquittal was a catalyst for the Los Angeles riots in 1992. Five days into the rioting and social unrest, King himself appeared on TV, pleading with the public, “Can we all get along?”

results.title: Laura Poitras in New York City
results.brief_description: Laura Poitras blurs the line between documentary and investigative journalism. Poitras was one of three journalists confided in by whistleblower Edward Snowden when he shared classified documents that detailed global government surveillance. Telling his story earned Poitras a Pulitzer, while Citizenfour won an Oscar.
results.description: Laura Poitras blurs the line between documentary and investigative journalism. Telling his story earned Poitras a Pulitzer, while Citizenfour won an Oscar.

results.title: Tales from a suitcase 3
results.creator_credit: Andrea Dal Bosco, David S. Vadiveloo, Will Davies, Look Television Productions and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: This acclaimed SBS series presents the stories behind migration to Australia during the 1950s when many people fled post-War atrocities, the rise of Communism and impoverishment. This tape contains three separate stories. Episode 7: Jutta Malnic, born in Berlin to an Australian mother and German father, had a childhood filled with exotic stories about a country which provided refuge after harrowing World War II experiences. A photographer, Jutta relays her remarkable journey from war-torn Europe and her interesting experiences as an emigre. Episode 8: Victor Vadiveloo was taken from his family in Sri Lanka at age 4 and sent to work on the Burmese railway at 14, before escaping. Upon emigrating to Australia Victor continued his studies in order to become a surgeon, and experienced excessive racism which only intensified when he fell in love and married a white woman. Episode 9: Rinaldo Fabbro, an Italian partisan fighter during World War II who was to become an architect of great acclaim, discusses his past, having arrived in Australia in 1949, in search of prosperity. Some quite remarkable tales emerge about these interesting times, told with finesse by various raconteurs and are an appealing mix of pathos and humour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrea Dal Bosco, David S. Vadiveloo, Will Davies, Look Television Productions and SBS Independent
